title: Are There Over-the-Counter (OTC) Erectile Dysfunction (ED) Pills?
author: Medical Editor John P Cunha; DO; FACOEP
description: There are several medications and treatments used to treat erectile dysfunction (ED, impotency), including Viagra (sildenafil), testosterone replacement therapy, penile self-injection, and others. Some over-the-counter (OTC) supplements may help, such as L-arginine with pycnogenol, Korean red ginseng (panax ginseng), Yohimbe, Carnitine (propionyl-L-carnitine), and Dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA).
cleaned_text: a condition that causes men to be unable to acquire or maintain an erection. Treatment for [erectile dysfunction](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_a_visual_guide_to_erectile_dysfunction/article_em.htm) is aimed at enabling a man to achieve and maintain an erection for sexual intercourse. Certain over-the-counter (OTC) [supplements](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/drug-multivitamins_and_minerals/article_em.htm) may help with [erectile dysfunction](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/impotence_erectile_dysfunction_quiz_iq/quiz.htm), such as: - L-arginine in combination with pycnogenol - Has been shown in studies to improve sexual function in men with [ED](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_a_visual_guide_to_erectile_dysfunction/article_em.htm) - Has been shown in studies to improve sexual function in men with - Korean red [ginseng](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/drug-ginseng/article_em.htm)(also called panax ginseng) - Studies have shown improvements in erections - Yohimbe - Some studies have shown it to be slightly more effective than placebo for [ED](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/impotence_erectile_dysfunction_quiz_iq/quiz.htm) - Some studies have shown it to be slightly more effective than placebo for - Carnitine (propionyl-L-carnitine) - May improve erectile dysfunction - Also used to enhance the effectiveness of [sildenafil](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/drug-sildenafil_oral/article_em.htm)( [Viagra](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/drug-sildenafil_oral/article_em.htm)) - Dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA) - Declines in DHEA are associated with increased incidence of ED - DHEA [supplements](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/vitamins_and_supplements_quiz_iq/quiz.htm)are often promoted to improve sexual health, though more study is needed Tell your doctor before taking any over-the-counter supplement. Use caution with any product that claims to be a non-prescription "herbal Viagra." Some of these products contain the actual drug, sildenafil, which should only be taken when prescribed by a doctor. They may also contain unlabeled ingredients that can cause serious side effects or interact with other medications you take. In addition to sildenafil (Viagra), medications used to treat erectile therapy - Used when man's testes do not produce sufficient amounts of the hormone testosterone - Does not work to improve sexual function in men who produce normal amounts of testosterone [Medications for depression](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/understanding_antidepressant_medications/article_em.htm)and/or [anxiety](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/anxiety/article_em.htm) Lifestyle modifications to treat may include: [Weight loss](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/weight_loss_and_control/article_em.htm)in men who are [obese](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/obesity/article_em.htm) - Don't smoke - Limit or avoid [alcohol](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/alcohol_quiz_iq/quiz.htm) [Exercise](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/exercise/article_em.htm)regularly - Eat a healthy, balanced [diet](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/diet_and_nutrition_quiz_iq/quiz.htm) - Pelvic floor exercises - Talk to your doctor about using different medications to treat [hypertension](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/high_blood_pressure/article_em.htm)and pain - Do not stop taking any prescribed medication without first talking to your doctor Psychotherapy and psychoactive medications may be recommended for men who have erectile dysfunction due to [depression](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/depression_health/article_em.htm) and/or anxiety. Counseling with a sex therapist may be helpful for men with performance anxiety. Medical treatments used to treat erectile dysfunction may include: - Penile self-injection - A medication ( [alprostadil](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/drug-alprostadil_injectable_and_transurethral/article_em.htm)or [papaverine](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/drug-papaverine/article_em.htm)) is self-injected into the two chambers of the penis that are filled with spongy tissue and blood ( [corpora cavernosa](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/impotence_erectile_dysfunction_quiz_iq/quiz.htm)) to cause an erection by allowing the blood vessels within the penis to expand so the penis swells and stiffens to create a fully rigid erection - A medication ( - Intraurethral alprostadil ( Uses the same medication (alprostadil) as penile self-injection but instead a man inserts a device with an alprostadil pellet (suppository) into the urethra to create an erection - Vacuum-assisted erection devices - Involves placing the penis into a plastic cylinder and creating a vacuum around the penis to increase blood flow into the penis - A rigid ring is placed at the base of the penis to hold the blood inside the penis, keeping it erect - Penile prostheses - Surgically implanted devices that inflate to allow the penis to become erect - Revascularization - A surgical procedure used for young men who have experienced pelvic [trauma](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/trauma_and_first_aid_quiz_iq/quiz.htm) - A surgical procedure used for young men who have experienced pelvic What Are Causes of Erectile Dysfunction? [Causes of erectile dysfunction](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/causes_of_erectile_dysfunction/article_em.htm) include: - - Neurological causes [Diabetes](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_pictures_type_2_diabetes/article_em.htm) [Stroke](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/stroke/article_em.htm) - Prostate surgery that damage nerves to the penis - Pelvic trauma [Spinal cord](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_pictures_low_back_pain/article_em.htm)or back injury [Multiple sclerosis](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/multiple_sclerosis/article_em.htm) [Dementia](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/dementia_overview/article_em.htm) - Previous episodes of prolonged erection (priapism) - - Drugs that affect the [nervous system](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/anatomy_of_the_central_nervous_system/article_em.htm)or that lower testosterone levels or inhibit testosterone action Alcohol such as [cocaine](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/cocaine_abuse/article_em.htm)and [heroin](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_pictures_prescription_drug_abuse/article_em.htm) - - Psychological causes [Depression](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_depression_overview/article_em.htm), which may include loss of sex drive - Performance anxiety - Lack of focus - - Other risk factors - Chronic [kidney disease](https://www.emedicinehealth.com/chronic_kidney_disease/article_em.htm) Endocrine disorders - Bicycling - Chronic From Men's Health Resources Featured Centers Health Solutions From
